intro: Binghamia laredensis, commonly known as the Laredo binghamia, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the coastal regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils near the coast, where it thrives in humid, saline conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical specimen from habitat loss and environmental degradation.
